; ;摘要。; ;

;一项涉及爱德曼和九个主要品牌的研究发现，尽管企业犹豫不决，但可持续产品的增长速度是传统产品的两倍，对所有人群都有吸引力。品牌应确保产品质量不受影响，同时促进可持续发展。将可持续发展主张与核心品牌属性相结合可以扩大消费者吸引力。有效的可持续发展信息优先考虑个人和社区利益，而技术或科学主张则不那么引人注目，除非与消费者利益挂钩。可持续营销的商品在不同人群中持续增长，这表明引人注目的可持续发展声明可以提高客户参与度和业务增长。

; ;
;
;
;
;
; ;西班牙语阅读;
; ;Ler em português;
;

;在这个两极分化的时代，企业领导者对于促进其产品的可持续性变得越来越不安。然而，;我们对实际消费者购买情况的研究;表明，在大多数人群中，可持续产品的增长速度是传统产品的两倍，平均溢价 28%。

;

;帮助品牌经理和营销主管利用这个不断增长的市场，我们与爱德曼和不同行业（科技、服装、饮料、食品）的九个领先品牌;合作，研究哪些可持续发展信息; 与当前关于两极分化消费者的夸张说法相反，我们发现，最能引起共鸣的可持续发展主张对于;所有;人口统计数据都极具吸引力 - 老年/年轻、蓝州/红州、高收入/低收入、男性/女性等。

;

;我们在 2022 年底/2023 年初针对九个标志性品牌对美国普通人群样本进行了定制在线研究。每个品牌的受访者被要求评估 30-35 种不同的主张（包括类别和环境可持续性主张的组合），以衡量其整体吸引力。我们没有使用传统的评级量表，而是使用了一种用户友好且强大的分析方法，称为 MaxDiff。它强制从每个选择集中的简短声明列表中选出顶部和底部的选项，使受访者的任务变得更容易，并在各个声明的响应中提供更好的区分。每个受访者评估了多个选择集，允许根据实验设计随机声明。 MaxDiff 结果对每项主张得出了上诉分数——总体上以及在关键利益子群体中。最重要的是，我们添加了 TURF 组件，以确定最佳的声明组合，以最大限度地提高整体吸引力。

;

;以下是见解和经验教训。

;

;核心类别声明至关重要 - 产品必须有效、美味、清洁等。这是有道理的。谁想要味道不好的可持续巧克力或不清洁的可持续清洁产品？然而，有时，营销材料只关注可持续性，这可能会限制品牌的潜力。

;

;基于核心品牌属性的令人信服的可持续性声明可以通过引入新消费者来显着扩大品牌影响力。如图 1 所示，核心属性声明可能会引起每 100 人中 44 人的共鸣（测试的 9 个品牌的平均值），但是当您添加引人注目的可持续发展声明时，您可以将客户吸引力提高到每 100 人中 74 人。高性能阶梯式声明的一个例子是：“采用对皮肤有益的可持续成分配制而成。”

;

;高反响的可持续声明重点关注对消费者的好处，从他们自己和他们的家人开始，然后扩展到他们的社区。例如：

;
    ;
  • ;对您和您的家人健康：食品“;在种植时不含有害成分合成杀虫剂、除草剂或杀菌剂”;，以及护肤品“;配方中不含有害成分对羟基苯甲酸酯、邻苯二甲酸盐、染料和铝”;
    • ;
  • ;为您省钱：;“降低每月能源费用，降低能耗”，;或;“有助于减少浪费和省钱。;”对于非消费品，信息传递可以强调耐用性和获得维修服务的机会。
    • ;
  • ;保护我们的孩子：“;为了后代。;”
    • ;
  • ;帮助当地农民：“;与当地农民合作，利用再生农业实践来帮助保护自然、鼓励生物多样性和改善土壤健康。;”仅谈论再生实践而不将其与当地农民联系起来的说法不会引起共鸣。
    • ;
  • ;Pro tects 动物：;“未在动物身上进行测试。”;
    • ;
  • ;可持续来源：“;源自 100% 可持续成分/材料。;”
    • ;
;

;表现较差的声明包括基于科学的声明、可追溯性、基于包装的声明和认证。换句话说，消费者对技术主题的兴趣不如对个人问题的兴趣。然而，如果将消费者关心的原因添加到基于科学的声明中，他们的表现会更好（例如，碳中和使呼吸空气更清洁，而不是碳中和）。认证虽然本身并没有引起很大反响，但对于确保品牌免受洗绿行为非常重要。

;

;总而言之，有效的可持续发展营销虽然在一定程度上针对特定类别，但具有对所有人群都有吸引力的十大组成部分。营销领导者可以使用以下指南来开发消息传递（并查看完整的报告）。应该强调的是，可持续营销需要与真实有效的可持续采购和生产实践联系起来。前进：

;
    ;
  • ;;首先优先考虑品牌利益的传达。;利用相关的可持续发展信息来强化品牌定位。
    • ;
  • ;;将可持续发展声明与类别存在理由联系起来。;“100%可持续种植，打造美味的产品。”
    • ;
  • ;;将声明重点放在对消费者及其家人的利益上。;考虑确保产品符合可持续发展声明。可供人类食用或接触，例如“不含对人体健康有害的化学物质”。用情感成分阐明这一主张，特别是当它与地球或其孩子的长期健康有关时，例如“对您的孩子/子孙后代有好处”或“对地球有好处”。在可能的范围内，为索赔提供个人金钱利益，例如“更长的寿命”、“更少的浪费”、“更低的能源费用”。
    • ;
  • ;;“可持续”一词与“可持续采购和生产”相关，令人信服;，不需要进一步解释。例如，“100% 可持续采购”、“100% 可持续生产”。
    • ;
  • ;;消费者关心动物福利;。如果合适，请进行沟通，以确保产品测试中不会对动物造成伤害，例如“无动物测试”或“无残忍”。
    • ;
  • ;对于食品和个人护理品类，如果可能的话;将声明与农民和当地采购联系起来，;例如“源自当地农民”。例如，当关注当地农民及其农场时，再生农业的主张就很引人注目。例如，“与当地农民合作，确保农场的长期健康，为我们粮食系统的未来服务。”或“与当地农民合作，确保农场保持气候适应力和营养丰富。”
    • ;
  • ;;在传达可持续发展的更科学方面时提供关心的理由;。 “碳中和以减少气候变化的影响”与“碳中和”本身。
    • ;
  • ;;量化可持续发展主张以获得更大的共鸣;，例如;、;“使用 100 万吨海洋回收的塑料瓶。”
    • ;
  • ;;使用认证来防止漂绿，但不要依赖它们作为唯一的信息点。;例如，“100% 可持续采购并由 Rainfor 认证” “est Alliance”比仅仅将标签贴在包装上效果更好。
    • ;
  • ;;使用完全可回收的包装交付产品;。虽然消费者普遍对可持续包装声明不太敏感，但“由 100% 再生塑料/纸板制成”是最引人注目的。
    • ;
;

;我们相信，引人注目的可持续包装声明将有助于企业提高消费者忠诚度和市场份额。在与 Circana（收集消费者购买数据）合作的另一项研究计划中，我们自 2019 年（回顾 2014 年）以来每年审查美国消费品的购买情况。在每年审查 36 个类别（数十万种产品）时，我们观察到传统产品不断向可持续产品转变。例如，2019年，在可持续营销产品方面，36个类别中的9个类别的市场份额超过20%，14个类别的市场份额低于5%。如今，有 13 个类别的比例超过 20%，有 9 个类别的比例低于 5%。

;

;而且，虽然购买者偏向年轻、富裕、城市和受教育程度较高的人群，但事实上，我们发现所有人群的购买量都很大。例如，可持续营销的牛奶和酸奶占据了超过 60% 的市场份额，几乎每个人群都会以同样的速度购买，包括农村、高中或以下学历、老年人和低收入人群（尽管溢价约为 30%）。

;

;商品的可持续生产对地球、消费者和企业都有利。企业领导者可以从这项研究中得到鼓舞，并投资于真实且引人注目的信息传递，以吸引客户、扩大市场份额并为社会做出积极贡献。

; Wed, 19 Jul 2023 22:25:03 +0800 20 Questions to Ask When Your Team’s Vibe Is Offhttps://hbr.org/2023/07/20-questions-to-ask-when-your-teams-vibe-is-off

;
; ;
; ;摘要。   ; ;

;您的团队是否忘记了自己的宗旨和共同努力的目标？如果是这样，那么可能是时候进行团队重组，重点是重新调整。或者，也许你的团队感觉不再像一个团队了？也许团队成员感到脱节、无效或沮丧，甚至小问题也会产生摩擦？在这种情况下，你的重置必须集中于重振团队活力。本文重点介绍管理者可以用来解决一致性差距的一些方法，以启动新的、更健康、更快乐的团队动态。

; ;
;
;
;
;
; ;阅读西班牙语;
; ;Ler em português;
;

;您的团队是否感到陷入困境、受阻或有点陈旧？您是否陷入了不再为您服务的日常生活中？没关系;即使在平静的水域中，团队也需要偶尔修正路线。在当今波涛汹涌的大海中，当我们处理重返办公室和混合工作安排时，您可能需要制定全新的路线。好消息是，重置团队可能比您想象的更容易。

;

;您的第一步是反思感觉不对的地方。您可以从两大类来思考它。首先，问题是你的团队忽视了你的目的和你正在努力实现的目标吗？如果是这样，你的重置将需要集中于重新调整。另一种可能性（也可能两者兼而有之）是你们不再感觉自己像一个团队了。也许团队成员会感到孤立、无效或沮丧——以至于即使是小问题也会产生摩擦。在这种情况下，你的重置必须集中于重振团队活力。以下是如何驾驭这两种方法：

;

;重新调整

;

;出于两个原因，您需要优先考虑重新调整而不是振兴。首先，许多团队功能障碍表现为信任问题，而实际上，它们源于目标、优先事项或期望的差异。消除这些误解通常可以解决您认为的人际问题。

;

;从重新调整开始的另一个原因是，它可以让您将重置与外部转变而不是个人行为问题联系起来，从而不太可能引发防御。当你重新调整时，你不是在评判任何人；而是在评判任何人。相反，您会问自己需要如何发展才能利用机遇并减轻新出现的风险。以下是一些重新调整的锚点。选择最适合您情况的选项。

;

;;重置团队的任务。;

;

;第一种可能性是您团队的目标需要发展。您可以通过这些问题探索这种可能性。

;
    ;
  • ;;哪些外部趋势需要我们适应？;外部环境中最显着的变化是什么，它们如何改变您团队的环境？例如，如果您是内容营销团队，ChatGPT 如何改变您团队的价值？
    • ;
  • ;;公司战略的转变如何影响您的角色？;您的组织是否有新的愿景、战略或 KPI 来改变您的团队需要交付的内容？例如，如果您是人力资源团队，开设欧洲办事处是否需要新的能力或活动？
    • ;
  • ;;您在组织中的价值如何演变？;随着组织的发展和变化，团队的角色也会发生变化。您的组织结构的变化将如何要求您重新关注？例如，如果您的研发团队现在支持两个单位而不是一个单位，您将如何定制您的产品？
    • ;
;

;;重置团队的目标。;

;

;如果您的任务发生了变化，您肯定需要重新审视您的目标，但即使您的目的没有改变，您的目标也可能需要更新。因此，请将这些视为移动目标的理由。

;
    ;
  • ;;您将如何在先前成果的基础上继续发展？;您在上个季度取得了哪些成就，这将如何改变您在接下来的几个季度中想要的轨迹？如果您已经实现了目标，它们是否足够雄心勃勃？另一方面，如果您一直未能实现目标，您是否需要降低目标或冒着让所有人士气低落的风险？
    • ;
  • ;;外部因素将如何影响您的目标？是否有任何外部因素可能表明目标发生变化？例如，您是否需要根据经济衰退、供应链积压或劳动力短缺来调整预期？另一方面，如果您的团队受益于新技术进步，您能否完成比计划更多的任务？
    • ;
  • ;;您可以采取哪些措施来改进措施？;您的目标是否模糊，或者您的指标是否模糊？提高一致性的最快方法可能是收紧您的定义或调整您的指标，使您是否获得吸引力更加明显。
    • ;
;

;;重置您的战略和战术。;

;

;基于您的任务或目标的任何更改都需要重新检查您的战略。但不要将策略更新限制在目标发生变化的情况下；考虑新的可能性可以随时进行良好的重置。

;
    ;
  • ;;您的策略与您的任务一致吗？;如果您的任务或目标发生了变化，您的策略必须如何改变以应对？例如，如果您的团队的任务是为您的软件产品添加专业服务，那么如何才能使该业务模式取得成功？
    • ;
  • ;;您在哪些方面需要修改策略？;如果您仍在朝着现有目标努力，那么什么是有效的，以及您可以在哪些方面改变策略？反过来说，你需要放弃什么？您可以在哪些方面加倍努力？
    • ;
  • ;;可能会出现什么意外情况？;即使您坚持现有的任务、目标、战略和战术，您也可以通过考虑新的场景并准备应急计划来进行重置。您当前的计划包含哪些假设？什么会否定这些假设？某些事情正在发生变化的先行指标是什么？
    • ;
;

;;重置你的角色。;

;

;你的团队可能走在正确的轨道上，但你没有优化团队成员的精力和才能。在这种情况下，请考虑有关个人责任的这些问题。

;
    ;
  • ;;人们需要改变角色吗？;角色或责任是否有任何改变可以提高团队中人员的效率？您需要更改某人的投资组合吗？您能否改变谁担任什么角色以获得多技能、发展或继任优势？谁可能会因新的挑战而重新焕发活力？
    • ;
  • ;;如何使责任更加直接？;是否有机会微调人们的责任，使其更具吸引力？是否存在共同责任削弱人们义务感的地方？如何通过明确谁拥有哪些决策来提高一致性、效率和有效性？
    • ;
;

;重组团队最具建设性的方法之一就是重新关注组织、同事和客户期望您做的事情。重新点燃团队的热情并提醒他们你正在为了什么而奋斗是最好的起点。

;

;振兴

;

;第二种类型的重置是振兴你的团队活力。是否感觉你已经从一个真正的团队变成了一群松散的人，整体只不过是各个部分的总和？或者更糟糕的是，不信任或不健康的冲突是否会让团队合作产生负面影响？在这种情况下，您的重置可能需要更少地关注您的团队需要做什么，而更多地关注您如何做。

;

;;重置您的沟通习惯。;

;

;随着时间的推移，团队可能会变得懒惰并陷入稀释联系的沟通模式。重新审视您的沟通习惯可以帮助您重新建立联系。

;
    ;
  • ;;您可以重置您的沟通渠道吗？;您是否默认使用某些未针对内容进行优化的沟通模式？例如，如果您使用 Zoom 来通知并通过电子邮件进行辩论，那么您就已经落后了。您能否使用更丰富的沟通工具来处理更新颖的内容、更有争议的讨论和不熟悉的参与者？您可以将信息项目分流到电子邮件吗？
    • ;
  • ;;什么保证同步通信？; ;研究;显示，普通人的会议时间比大流行之前增加了一倍以上。您可以异步共享哪些类型的信息，而不是让人们更好地控制自己的日程安排？
    • ;
  • ;;如何实施停电期？; 除了大量的会议之外，大多数人还被大量的电子邮件淹没。您的团队如何强制执行封锁期，让人们可以关闭通知并在没有通信义务的情况下工作？如何增加人们;不受干扰;工作的机会？
    • ;
;

;;重置会议。;

;
    ;
  • ;;如何优化站立会议？;内容同质化的会议往往会更有效。您能否清理;会议结构;，以区分需要不同心态和行为的内容？
    • ;
  • ;;参与者列表需要更改吗？;重置对话的一种方法是更改​​参与方。是时候退出一些会议并让您的团队掌控一切了吗？新的声音和新的观点会带来一些;富有成效的冲突;吗？
    • ;
  • ;;你需要做好更好的准备吗？;低效的会议会让人恼火。您如何使用;更好的入门文档;来帮助团队成员做好准备，以循证且深思熟虑的方式做出贡献？
    • ;
;

;;重置您的团队动力。;

;
    ;

; Mon, 17 Jul 2023 21:25:03 +0800 How to Manage an Employee Who Always Makes Excuseshttps://hbr.org/2023/07/how-to-manage-an-employee-who-always-makes-excuses
; ;
; ;
; ;Olena Koliesnik/Getty Images;
;
; ;
; ;摘要。; ;

;如果员工屡次失败，原因之一通常是他们不知道出现会是什么样子。管理者以速度的名义缩短前期协调对话的情况是很常见的。但这种仓促可能会让你付出代价，尤其是对于一个不可靠的员工。预先对一致性进行投资可以实现良好的性能，并且还提供了解决性能不佳（如果性能持续不佳）的框架。作为经理，你的工作是创建一个流程，作为绩效脚手架，以加强员工的一致性、能力和积极性。从您分配任务的那一刻到他们交付任务的那一刻，此过程应该为该人员提供支持。它还应该否定他们的标准借口。当然，你在脚手架上到底需要哪些木板取决于这个人的具体缺点。通过一个流程来帮助他们取得成功并消除他们的潜力。然后，如果员工未能交付成果并诉诸“但是，但是，但是”，您已获得绩效管理对话所需的所有素材。

; ;
;
;
;
;
; ;阅读西班牙语;
; ;Ler em português;
;

;您如何管理业绩不佳且只提供借口的员工？生气并不是正确的解决办法。微观管理只会增加你的工作量，并告诉他们你将承担责任，所以他们不必这样做。那么，当您不信任某人交付成果时，您有什么选择？

;

;另一种选择是从信任该人转向信任流程。

;

;让我们考虑一下员工可能失败的原因。这将为我们提供线索，让我们知道在哪些方面可以通过更健全的流程来消除借口。首先，他们可能不知道你对他们的期望是什么，或者做好工作需要什么。这就是一个对齐问题。其次，他们可能缺乏完成任务的知识或技能——能力问题。最后，他们可能缺乏越过界限（或走出大门）的动力。为了取得成功，员工需要了解要做什么、知道如何做并且愿意这样做。

;

;如果员工屡次失败，则说明他们缺少一个或多个基本支柱。你的工作是创建一个流程，作为绩效脚手架，以加强他们的一致性、能力和动力。从您分配任务的那一刻到他们交付任务的那一刻，此过程应该为该人员提供支持。它还应该否定他们的标准借口。但是，当然，你在这个脚手架上到底需要哪些木板取决于这个人的具体缺点。

;

;;提供明确的目标;

;

;员工让你失望的原因之一是他们不知道出现会是什么样子。管理者常常以速度的名义缩短前期的协调对话。但这种仓促可能会让你付出代价，尤其是对于一个不可靠的员工。预先对一致性的投资可以实现良好的绩效，并且还提供了解决绩效不佳（如果绩效持续不佳）的框架。

;

;首先关注工作的目的。确立目标后，就不会为不同的观点、动机或最终目标留下任何借口。如果这个人没有战略眼光，看不到大局，或者他们自私自利，倾向于将自己的成功置于团队的成功之上，那么从目标开始也是有帮助的。你需要清楚地说明你想要实现的目标。这是给谁的？受益人如何定义成功？这项工作与其他举措或承诺有何契合点？回答这些问题可以减少对方声称他们不知道您想要什么的机会。

;

;一旦您对工作目的达成一致，您就可以描绘出好的、坏的和不可接受的结果会是什么样子。但不幸的是，这是管理者经常跳过的另一个步骤。我将其称为情人节效应；无法清楚地表达出你想要什么，并且当对方没有做到时感到失望。对于你已经心存疑虑的员工来说，未能明确你的期望几乎肯定会让你失望。为了给他们的工作提供一个标准，描述最低标准。你认为什么是本垒打？哪些结果会令人担忧或您认为是失败？回答这些问题可以消除员工将劣质工作假装为“足够好”的可能性。

;

;当你明确目标时，你就消除了一致性借口。

;

;;与最佳方法保持一致;

;

;员工可能为表现不佳找借口的第二个主要原因是他们没有技能或知识来完成你要求的事情。 If your trepidation is tied to gaps in the person's capability, your process must go beyond what they need to achieve and explore how they'll achieve it. Depending on your specific concerns, there are a few ways to broach this.

;

;When you suspect that the person might take shortcuts or neglect essential components, get into some detail about the required steps. Share effective approaches and provide precedents from previous projects. But don't make the mistake of doing all the talking; their nodding head cannot be interpreted as understanding. Instead, find out how they're processing the request by asking them to share their plan. Then you can provide any required course corrections with questions that direct their attention, such as, “What steps will you take to ensure finance is on board?” Answering these questions will remove the excuse that they didn't know how to tackle the project.

;

;Another possibility is that you're worried not about their technical but their people skills. If you're nervous that they'll botch the stakeholder relationships, make the interpersonal issues as salient as the technical ones. Work together to map the key stakeholders, their stake in the project, and any idiosyncrasies you might know. Who has sway over the decision? What are they looking for? What influences them? And beyond the decision makers and influencers, encourage the person to think about other people with valuable perspectives they need to include. Answer these questions to avoid excuses about insufficient support or ornery partners.

;

;You can also mitigate capability gaps by contemplating the decisions they might have to make and pre-qualifying the decision criteria. That way, you can be more confident that they'll make calls you'd endorse. You can broach the subject in various ways, including asking about the criteria the person will use to evaluate any decisions or trade-offs. How will they prioritize the criteria when there isn't a perfect option? And lest they get stuck trying to have it all, it's helpful to clarify which criteria should influence how they implement the decision but not which decision they take.

;

;When you agree on the process, you strip away many of the capability excuses.

;

;;Raise the Stakes;

;

;We've discussed alignment and capability issues. The third possibility for their failure is that they lack the motivation to get the job done. If your loss of faith is associated with their lack of oomph, emphasize their obligation and clarify what's at stake if they fail to deliver.

;

;You have both carrot and stick options if you need to add a little incentive. Dangling the carrot would connect the successful delivery of the work to a variety of positive outcomes, such as how it will affect their reputation or future opportunities. On the other hand, wielding the stick entails listing negative ramifications if they don't deliver. And if possible, add some intrinsic rewards to those extrinsic consequences by talking about what the person enjoys about this kind of work and what reward they'd get from doing it well.

;

;There's one other motivation issue to prepare for; the person who starts full of vim and vigor but throws up their hands at the first hint of adversity. In that case, your process should inoculate the person against setbacks by preparing a plan B upfront. Spend some time anticipating what could go wrong and creating a game plan. What issues do you anticipate arising? How might they handle those types of problems? Be sure to specify which circumstances warrant the person escalating to you and which you'd expect them to tackle independently. Addressing the contingencies and potential pitfalls will make it clear that you expect the person to persevere.

;

;When you articulate the consequences, you bolster the motivation.

;

;If you're managing a person who keeps letting you down and making excuses for why it wasn't their fault, don't waste your energy hoping they'll miraculously become trustworthy. Instead, work through a process that sets them up for success and removes the excuses in the process. Then if the employee fails to deliver and falls back on the “but, but, but…,” you've got all the fodder you need for a performance management conversation.

; ;

;
; ;
; ;Summary.   ; ;

;Pentagon procurement procedures have long complicated commercial software companies’ entrance into the defense market difficult, but the authors’ experience working with both tech startups and the defense industry leads them to believe that now is a good time for companies to enter the market. They recommend starting by using commercial success to prompt small, one-time defense contracts, partnering with existing defense channels, and building a dedicated sales team. These tactics will bring the company recurring revenue and venture funding more quickly.

; ;
;
;
;
;
; ;Leer en español;
; ;Ler em português;
;

;When US software firms consider their primary markets, many largely avoid the defense sector. That's true whether they are established tech companies or early-stage startups. The reasons are clear: Pentagon ;procurement; has historically, and largely, focused only on the acquisition of physical supplies and equipment, yielding processes unsuited to software licensing. ;Bureaucratic challenges; also frustrate companies because they lead to long sales cycles. And many tech employees have refused to work on defense projects, ;citing cultural and ethical concerns;. With these challenges, funding through venture capital and other sources has been hard to come by for firms operating in or looking to expand into the defense market.

;

;However, there have always been exceptions, like Amazon, Microsoft, and Google cloud services — or early-stage emerging technology startups, like the 50-person startup ;Pendulum; — that expanded to the defense market soon after finding commercial product-market fit. These exceptions prove that US software companies can succeed in the defense market. In addition, multiple factors are making the Defense Department's $800 billion budget more accessible to these firms. (We focus on the US in this article because it's hard to draw parallels to other countries' very different startup cultures and defense markets.)

;

;Our experience working with both startups and the defense industry leads us to believe that now is the time for founders of expanding software firms to consider the defense market. In this article we'll explain why and lay out a plan for selling to the government while attracting funding along the way.

;

;;Why now?;

;

;Three factors make the defense market a much more appealing vertical for US software startups today.

;

;First, the Pentagon is a motivated customer and has already made some moves to court software vendors. ;Determined; to ;keep pace; with China;,; it has increased ;the speed; at which it procures and integrates emerging technologies by revising a number of its existing acquisition processes. The Defense Department has also established commercial-friendly organizations (such as the Defense Innovation Unit and AFWERX) and software-specific procurement processes (such as the ;Authority to Operate; and ;Platform One;). It has created cloud software certifications such as ;FedRAMP; and partnered with AWS to offer ;GovCloud; to make it easier for software vendors to satisfy the security requirements to get their product in front of government employees. These changes have made it possible to spread commercial software to the government.

;

;Second, the defense market is stable amidst many commercial market headwinds. Widespread layoffs and the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank have roiled commercial markets. For software companies, the market ;downturn; has caused return on sales spending to ;drop;, customers to ;slash; IT budgets, and large enterprise sales to ;take longer; to close. In contrast, the Defense Department is a stable customer. The Pentagon maintains a consistent and large budget, with high switching costs for their software solutions. Once a company lands a recurring revenue contract, annual revenue allocations are significant and low risk. This gives the Pentagon qualities similar to the largest, most attractive enterprise-sized commercial customers while also making it a more stable customer.

;

;Third, private capital investors are increasingly supporting companies in the defense market. The value of venture capital deals into aerospace and defense tech was ;greater; in each of 2021 and 2022 than in all of 2010 through 2019 combined. We believe that the upward trend is caused by investor desire to engage a critical, yet digitally undisrupted industry. And it seems to be working: Defense contracts in areas like cybersecurity and AI are enabling investors to capture returns on investment. Landing recurring revenue from federal government contracts ;shows; enterprise ;company; maturity and ;the;; ability to address complex needs;. For AI data labeling startup Scale AI, for example, expanding into defense meant a trajectory-defining ;$250 million contract; a year after their Series E. Top-tier firms like ;Andreessen Horowitz;, ;Founders Fund;, and ;Lux Capital; and defense-focused firms like ;America's Frontier Fund; and ;Shield Capital; are among those investing in the space.

;

;;How to tackle the defense marketplace;

;

;Despite the attraction, thousands of startups ;leave; the defense market. Companies fail in the defense market because they mistake non-recurring revenue from the Pentagon as success and then ;get trapped in the “valley of death,”; crumbling before they build a scalable product worthy of recurring software subscriptions. (While most software companies aim for a recurring revenue model to gain stability and scale, this is even more critical for companies in the defense market, in which new contracts present even higher up-front R&D and customer acquisition costs.) On the other hand, companies also fail by focusing exclusively on generating annual recurring revenue through big-ticket sales like ;programs of record;, running out of money chasing ;long federal sales cycles;.

;

;Or they redesign their commercial products to meet the specific needs of individual defense customers. Such bespoke specifications limit the utility of the product to other defense customers, preventing scale.

;

;In contrast, we've observed that companies which have successfully scaled within the defense market have taken these three tactics:

;

;;Use Commercial Traction to Secure Early Defense Revenue ;

;

;A commercial company should enter the defense market only after it has achieved commercial product-market fit, where growth efforts are clearly resulting in customer traction. This allows the company to focus on defense customers that align most closely with its commercial customers while preventing  it from over-specializing specific defense products that are incapable of wider scale. In addition, commercial sales help these companies stay afloat during long federal sales cycles.

;

;For such an early-stage company, the first step into the defense market must be to secure non-recurring revenue, ie, one-time grants, such as Small Business Innovation Research (;SBIR;) awards and/or Accelerate the Procurement and Fielding of Innovative Technologies (;APFIT;). These opportunities provide the funding necessary for companies to avoid what is called the “valley of death” — in which a company perpetually achieves one-time revenue contracts that are unable to deliver sufficient returns on investment to justify costs — by identifying defense revenue potential and possible defense product-market fit while mitigating the costs startups face in the defense market.

;

;The key, however, is to not mistake non-recurring revenue for success, or even meaningful business. Rather, non-recurring revenue comprises the training wheels for the earliest-stage companies to first find defense product-market fit and build relationships before taking the next steps to secure recurring revenue.

;

;;Use Existing Channels to Get to Recurring Revenue Faster;

;

;A company can cut down the time required to move from non-recurring revenue to recurring revenue by leveraging existing sales channels — big players already in the business of selling to the defense market. The most common channel partners are prime defense contractors like Lockheed Martin, Boeing, and Northrop Grumman. “Primes” are intimately familiar with procurement processes and control multiple channels for delivering solutions through the Pentagon's 2.2-million-person bureaucracy. Partnering with these primes enables companies to quickly deliver product to government employees so they can validate product-market fit as soon as possible.

;

;The primes' sales channels offer several opportunities to validate product-market fit. For example, Applied Intuition, an autonomy software company, started in the automotive sector but identified a defense market need for its offerings. As a first foray into defense, they subcontracted with prime contractor and vehicle manufacturer General Dynamics to ;bid on an autonomous vehicle design in 2021;. Since then, they've been able to win meaningful ;direct defense business;. Primes also offer an opportunity for software companies to integrate their product within a prime's hardware platforms so companies don't have to build their own hardware or convince government buyers to sign up for annual software subscriptions. Overwatch Imaging, for example, puts their imaging software on cameras that prime contractor L3Harris sells directly to the government, bypassing the need to have government buyers subscribe to Overwatch Imaging's software directly.

;

;There are some downsides to working with primes. As hardware or services businesses, their meager software-reselling efforts may generate revenue at levels that are uninteresting to startups; they also often ;squeeze their suppliers on payment terms;. Companies may also get stuck as subcontractors only to be acquired for a middling price. For companies that decide that partnering with a prime is too risky, there are other existing channels to explore, such as big tech platforms like AWS and Snowflake. Their marketplaces tend to work better with software partners — though big tech platforms offer less value to startups in the defense marketplace than primes..

;

;Regardless, the value companies find in working with any of these existing sales channels is saving time and money in learning whether selling to the Defense Department is a compelling business strategy.

;

;;Build a Dedicated Team to Scale Defense Sales ;

;

;Successful commercial-first companies with validated defense product-market fit can scale their product and achieve sustainable recurring revenue by establishing a dedicated federal sales team. Properly setting up a federal team allows companies to chase recurring revenue opportunities and create a steadfast defense software business.

;

;Commercial deals close ;in a matter of months; and larger deals take closer to a year, while federal deals typically take ;well over a year;. Thus successful commercial companies entering the defense market compensate their federal sales teams through multi-year quotas and pay commissions on renewals to ensure deep, long-term product deployment. These companies measure federal sales success by focusing on upcoming pipeline and customer touchpoints.

;

;Federal sales require salespeople who possess the rare combination of having federal customer knowledge and relationships (usually through public sector experience), as well as a personality suited for the team-based environment necessary to close complex federal deals, relative to commercial salespeople, who tend to be territorial and competitive.

;

;The objective of the sales team is to achieve the annual recurring revenue necessary to grow a strong defense business. The most popular goal is for the company to be included in ;Programs of Record;, meaning that they are working on a project tied into a line item written in the Defense Department's annual budget. However, there are other options to capture recurring revenue. One popular pathway is through the decentralized ;Operations & Maintenance (O&M) contracts; widely available across the Department. Accessing these types of funds requires consistent coordination with operational military personnel, but obtaining the contracts can be incredibly simple (for example, the ;GSA schedule;). This is analogous to bottoms-up, ;product-led; growth rather than a centralized approach.

;

;;Finding the right investor backing;

;

;While companies can seek investor support at any of these steps, companies have the greatest likelihood of raising funding after finding product-market fit in the defense market. Three categories of venture capital (VC) firms operate in the defense market: Large firms, defense-oriented firms, and strategic investors.

;

;Large VC firms are generalist firms possessing billion-dollar-funds, such as Andreessen Horowitz, General Catalyst, and Founders Fund. They fund companies that can become category-defining unicorns. The reason for this is that VC returns are driven by a few successful outliers (often called the ;Power Law;): The larger the fund size, the bigger individual companies need to become to return the fund's capital. Therefore, headline-grabbing VC defense investments often highlight companies like ;Anduril; that only pursue defense sales because they are capable of challenging existing prime contractors. But commercial companies entering the defense market can also secure checks from large VC firms after demonstrating the potential for massive scale across the Pentagon. For example, while ;Scale AI; only had a $750,000 non-recurring SBIR before raising their $325 million Series E, the additional funding helped them get a $250 million defense contract a year later.

;

;Many defense investments also come from specialist mid-sized VC firms that explicitly help companies scale in defense. For example, America's Frontier Fund and Shield Capital have traditional venture capital fund structures but dedicate their resources and networks to support companies selling to defense. Specialist VCs do not need category-defining success to make the same return allowing them to support a wider range of companies selling to defense.

;

;Strategic corporate investors such as Lockheed Martin Ventures and Boeing's HorizonX-AE Industrial study emerging technologies and offer strategic partnerships on top of earning returns. For example, Lockheed Martin Ventures' efforts to scout AI/ML tech ;led to its investment; in Fiddler. Strategic investors look after their parent corporation's strategic interests and can even help startups become a vendor to their parent corporation (L3Harris invested in Overwatch Imaging while adopting their technology). Strategic government investors such as In-Q-Tel, the US intelligence community's venture capital outfit, prioritize technology relevance. Strategic investors can often help with getting non-recurring funding, being a channel partner at the earliest stages, and providing credibility for the next round.

;

;The defense market is primed to be transformed by cutting-edge software. This sea change need not be limited to a select few defense-only tech startups or contractors. Defense can be a lucrative additional vertical, for today's US commercial software companies—one that looks particularly attractive today.

;由此，我们看到了三个对于想要提高团队士气、福祉和绩效的管理者和领导者来说，他们可能采取行动，尤其是在艰难或不确定的时期。

;

;振兴

;

;在任何组织中，能量和输出差异;很多;;在个体之间;。同一个员工可能这一年的工作效率很高，而下一年就效率低下。

;

;在不利的情况下（例如经济危机、政治不稳定、全球大流行等），士气和绩效可能会下降在很多球队中。因此，管理者和领导者应该专注于振兴他们的团队，这从根本上讲是再次激励和激励人们。

;

;实现这一目标的一个好方法是从原因开始，这与关键的理念相一致。领导力的一个方面是;“管理意义;;。;”人类渴望意义，而领导者能够很好地塑造意义，帮助我们理解世界。

; <最重要的任务是经常强调团队所做的工作为何重要。即使在严峻的经济条件下，大多数人的职业生涯也有其他选择，这给他们的职业生涯带来了疑问和不确定性，包括去哪里、下一步做什么以及如何决定。

;

;当领导者帮助人们记住并接受为什么;，;他们更有可能相信自己对公司目标的成功至关重要。这是充满活力的，可以让人感到重新充满活力。实现这一目标的一种方法是庆祝过去的成就并将其与未来的目标和成功联系起来。强调团队成员之间的社会联系，并提醒团队成员他们共同的历史和过去的挑战，帮助他们感受到彼此之间的联系以及团队的使命。

;

;您可以采取哪些措施来恢复活力？

;
    ;
  • ;强调并再次强调团队或组织的目标。
    • ;
  • ;询问人们什么对他们重要，他们真正关心/相信什么。
    • ;
  • ;询问人们描述他们的工作（他们的角色）如何影响团队并最终影响客户（或组织工作所服务的客户）
    • ;
  • ;邀请人们说出他们从彼此身上得到了什么 - 他们对合作的欣赏之处.
    • ;
;

;修复

;

;这是关于利用领导力来治愈现有和过去的创伤、恢复福祉并解决人类问题而不是商业问题。所有人际关系都会因误解、分歧、冲突和失败而破裂。聪明的领导者帮助他们的;团队从失败中学习;并将其转化为宝贵的经验教训。

;

;要实现这一目标，漏洞大有帮助，可以实现;心理安全;以及团队中的坦诚。开放、透明、诚实和自我批评，所有这些都是为了促进公开对话并团结团队追求协作和进步。我们认为，评估领导才能的最佳方法之一是检查您作为经理或领导者收到的坏消息与好消息的比例：如果低于 2 比 5，您可能还有改进的空间。

;

;你能做些什么来修复？

;
    ;
  • ;建议你的团队看看他们最近的一些挣扎/故障。找出一两个突出的重要性，或者只是最近足以有利于进行诚实对话的事情。
    • ;
  • ;接下来，请每个人考虑他们在某些方面做了或没做的事情。小或大的方式可能在崩溃中发挥了作用。
    • ;
  • ;倾听、理解、原谅、重新承诺。
    • ;
;

;重新聚焦

;

;帮助您的团队通过让团队成员在关键优先事项上保持一致来重新集中注意力。请记住，少即是多，尤其是当团队疲惫不堪时。

;

;还要记住，你永远不能过度沟通，而沟通不足比你想象的更容易，也是大多数团队问题的主要原因。特别是，回避困难的对话和避免冲突是确保未来发生更严重冲突的必由之路。

;

;考虑以清晰的战略会议结束每年（或开始新的一年），协调一致人们了解关键目标和执行计划。请记住，正如迈克尔·波特;指出的;，战略既是决定不做什么，也是决定做什么。您的主要目标应该是确保每个人都了解什么、为什么以及如何，让他们对乘坐公共汽车、前往诱人的目的地感到兴奋，并发挥自己的作用，帮助每个人共同实现具有挑战性的目标。这样，整个旅程就会变得愉快。

;

;你可以做什么来重新集中注意力？

;

;向你的团队提出以下问题：

;
    ;
  • ;什么我们可以做得更好吗？
    • ;
  • ;我们可以放弃什么？
    • ;
  • ;对于实现我们真正认为重要的工作来说，什么才是真正重要的
    • ;
;

;最后一个考虑因素与您有关……不是作为经理，而是作为一个人。就像在飞机上，我们被告知要戴上氧气面罩才能帮助别人，我们必须先帮助自己。你给团队注入活力的能力取决于你自己是否能保持理智、冷静和充满活力。为自己的健康而努力是无可替代的，管理自己是管理他人的重要先决条件。从这个意义上说，你可能犯的最严重的领导错误就是将你的团队置于你自己之上，因为只有当你能够振兴、修复和重新集中自己时，你才能帮助你的员工效仿。
